question: Which of the following made the statement,"In my belief, Congress is tottering to its fall and one of my great ambitions while in India is to assist it to a peaceful demise"?
option1: Lord Curzon, in a letter to the Secretary of States in 1900
option2: Lord Curzon, while announcing the partition of Bengal
option3: Lord Dufferin, during the farewell speech at Calcutta
option4: Lord Minto, while addressing the Muslim delegation which met him at Shimla in 1906
answer: Lord Curzon, in a letter to the Secretary of States in 1900
explanation: Lord Curzon was the Viceroy of India in 1898. He was mainly famous for the partition of Bengal. He was very much keen to suppress the Indian national movement. He made the statement,"In my belief, Congress is tottering to its fall and one of my great ambitions while in India is to assist it to a peaceful demise."
